intro: Anil declinata, commonly known as the drooping anil, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often drooping stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. Anil declinata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
